title: Houdon George Washington-symbolism of bound rods

content.question: Although the bound rods in Jean-Antoine Houdon’s portrait statue of George Washington allude to republican ideals of ancient governance, they may also refer to

choices.label: Washington’s willingness to surrender all claims to power
the original thirteen colonies that revolted against Britain
a Roman emperor who chose life as a civilian after war
a society of retired army generals who served as senators

content.answer: the original thirteen colonies that revolted against Britain

topic.text: 4.1: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Later European and American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain how and/or why context influences artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, and/or function in the creation or meaning of a work of art (or group of related works of art).
